variant.question: What is the role of a safety manager?

options.text: Facilitate hazard perception & provide periodic reports on safety performance
Facilitate hazard perception & audit training
Provide periodic reports on safety performance only
Ensure aircraft are using safe routes in line with global politics

variant.question: What is the purpose of the safety management board

options.text: Allocate resources
Ensure safety is performed with minimal expense
Control financial spend for safety
Report to the state of authority

variant.question: In accordance with ICAO Annex 17, which of the following areas can be considered as "Security Restricted Areas" at an airport?

options.text: Airside catering and aircraft cleaning premises.
All airport buildings to which passengers have access.
The area within a radius of 5.3 km of an airport.
All passenger and baggage check-in areas.

variant.question: Which of the following is the best definition of screening?

options.text: Detecting weapons and explosives that could be used to commit acts of unlawful interference.
Placing suspicious baggage, cargo, or packages behind a screen in the passenger lounge for isolation purposes.
Using technology such as X-rays to detect drugs and similar substances.
Moving suspicious baggage, cargo, or packages airside, away from passengers.

variant.question: The objective of aviation security is to:

options.text: safeguard international civil aviation operations against acts of unlawful interference.
regulate the transportation of dangerous goods by air.
ensure that commercial flight operations are safe end secure.
ensure that adequate maintenance standards are applied by all operators.

variant.question:
What should an operators security checklist contain?

1. Aircraft specific checks
ii. Actions on bomb discovery.
iii. Sabotage
iv. Suspicious item removal procedures.

options.text: i, ii, iv.
ii, iii, iv.
i, ii, iii.
i, ii, iii, iv.

variant.question: What do you understand by "aircraft security check"?

options.text: It is an inspection of those parts of the interior of the aircraft to which passengers may have had access, together with an inspection of the hold of the aircraft in order to detect prohibited articles and unlawful interferences with the aircraft.
It is an inspection carried out before flight to ensure that the aircraft is fit for the intended flight.
It is an inspection done by a flight safety inspector who checks if airworthiness certificate of an aircraft is valid.
It is an inspection of the interior and accessible exterior of the aircraft in order to detect prohibited articles and unlawful interferences that jeopardise the security of the aircraft.

variant.question: Which of the following statements best describes the term ?Unidentified Baggage' in accordance with ICAO Annex 17? Baggage at an airport,?

options.text: with or without a baggage tag, which is neither picked up by nor associated with a passenger.
with a baggage tag, which has been mishandled and is in the process of being rushed to its intended destination.
with or without a baggage tag, which has been waiting to be picked up by a passenger for more than 72 hours.
without a baggage tag, which has been waiting to be picked up by a passenger for more than 24 hours.

variant.question: When establishing security at an airport, which are the objectives (general principles) with regard to ICAO Annex 17?

options.text: Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of passengers, crew, ground personnel and the general public in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.
Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of the general public in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.
Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of passengers and crew in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.

Each Contracting State shall have as its primary objective the safety of passengers, crew and ground personnel in all matters related to safeguarding against acts of unlawful interference with civil aviation.

variant.question: What must be included in the security and training procedures created by the operator? - Specific aircraft type checklists - Detection of suspicious package - Removal of suspicious package - Sabotage procedures
